body: Yeah, i mean it's really strange. Because this inheritance is really cool feature when it comes to making `swagger.yml` file less and reuse as much objects as possible. But because of this nullable override everything got broken in the code and you still need to duplicate stuff...
How about I allow x-nullable to be able to override (like for the other object in your definition)? Would that help?

issue.title: allow x-nullable hint to override allOf nullability status

body:
@HarlamovBuldog something like that https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/pull/2365
I am just allowing here the x-nullable hint to work in that case: a rather simple fix, not breaking other expectations.
@fredbi so basically you mean that if I will specify `x-nullable:false` in `ItemBundleSectionResponse` it will override it's base `BundleSectionResponse`, right?

Yeah. Have a look at the fixture I've added to my PR. It does the job, but yes, it requires some extra hint in the specification.
I did that because deciding whether to have `[]*MyType` or `[]MyType` is a headache... and changing this behavior is difficult. Both are somehow valid and correspond to different use cases.

> Yeah. Have a look at the fixture I've added to my PR. It does the job, but yes, it requires some extra hint in the specification.
> I did that because deciding whether to have `[]*MyType` or `[]MyType` is a headache... and changing this behavior is difficult. Both are somehow valid and correspond to different use cases.

Okay, cool, thx.
@fredbi could you tell plz when the next release will be?
